metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36323 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, there is an optimization for joining strings that can cause uninitialized bytes to be exposed (or the program to crash) if the borrowed string changes after its length is checked.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.53 - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-all - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-clippy - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-gdb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-lldb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-src - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rustc - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rustfmt - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1').
